-- SQL Server Schema Creation Script
-- Generated by Encina Module Isolation
-- This script is idempotent and can be run multiple times safely

-- Create schema: lookup
IF NOT EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM sys.schemas WHERE name = N'lookup')
BEGIN
    EXEC('CREATE SCHEMA [lookup]');
    PRINT 'Created schema: lookup';
END
ELSE
BEGIN
    PRINT 'Schema already exists: lookup';
END
GO

-- Create schema: shared
IF NOT EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM sys.schemas WHERE name = N'shared')
BEGIN
    EXEC('CREATE SCHEMA [shared]');
    PRINT 'Created schema: shared';
END
ELSE
BEGIN
    PRINT 'Schema already exists: shared';
END
GO

-- Create schema: orders
IF NOT EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM sys.schemas WHERE name = N'orders')
BEGIN
    EXEC('CREATE SCHEMA [orders]');
    PRINT 'Created schema: orders';
END
ELSE
BEGIN
    PRINT 'Schema already exists: orders';
END
GO

-- Create schema: payments
IF NOT EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM sys.schemas WHERE name = N'payments')
BEGIN
    EXEC('CREATE SCHEMA [payments]');
    PRINT 'Created schema: payments';
END
ELSE
BEGIN
    PRINT 'Schema already exists: payments';
END
GO

PRINT 'Schema creation completed successfully.';
